result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter B Whitty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50+ costs = $616 (including domestic abuse surcharge), to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 2/28/17 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Total remaining balance after application of any bond money divided by 50 is to be the # of days in jail. this is to be determined by the Bookkeeper.

The Court orders that any bond that is pending forfeiture is to be scheduled for final bail/bond forfeiture hearing.
Any Bond that is not associated with any forfeiture order is to be applied to be applied.

The Court orders Mr. Whitty to provide a DNA sample

[MA] Case called at 2:08pm 
Defendant Peter B Whitty in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Whitty

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50+ costs = $616 (including domestic abuse surcharge), to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 2/28/17 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Total remaining balance after application of any bond money divided by 50 is to be the # of days in jail. this is to be determined by the Bookkeeper.

The Court orders that any bond that is pending forfeiture is to be scheduled for final bail/bond forfeiture hearing.
Any Bond that is not associated with any forfeiture order is to be applied to be applied.

The Court orders Mr. Whitty to provide a DNA sample 
3 days sentence credit

Case called at 1:34pm [mo]
Defendant Peter B Whitty appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 


The Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions as previously set. 

recess 1:38  pm. 


NEXT: Status Conference on 10/18/16 at 8:30am

Case called at 10:13 am [sf]
Attorney David Zarwell in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that he is not expecting Mr. Whitty.
ADA Teuber advises that the State has victim rights compliance, but that we may need to wait for the surety.
Court indicates that if the surety shows upat 10:15 am that the Court will be here to hear from her then.
Court finds the bond in default and orders it forfeited.
Corut will sign an order if one is needed.
recess: 10:13 am
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for 8/8/16 at 10:15 am

Case called at 9:56 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Attorney David Zarwell in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Peter B Whitty not in court.  
Court notes that Mr. Whitty's notice was returned as undeliverable
ADA Hall informs the Court that Mr. Whitty was dismissed from program as the State has lost contact with Mr. Whitty. Have attempted by phone, email and via mail. 
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that he was court appointed Counsel in this matter and has had no contact with Mr. Whitty since his entry into FOP and since his revocation into FOP.
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only 
ADA Hall requests bond to be found in default
Court finds the bond to be in default and orders it to be forfeited
Recess: 9:59 am

[MK] case called at 11:23am. 
Defendant Peter B Whitty in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.  Mr. Whitty indicates that he intends to apply for PD representation. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by Mr. Whitty. 

The Court requires $150 cash bond (the clerk is to refund $200 of the $350 amount posted to the payor, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence toward any person
--not to discuss the facts of the case with Ashley Nevel
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 11:26am
